title: How to Make an Organza Table Runner

steps.headline: Assemble the supplies needed.
steps.description: These are listed below under "Things You'll Need".

steps.headline: Cut the organza material into two strips.
steps.description: The strips should measure 2 meters (6.6 ft) in length and 35 centimeter (13.8 in) width.

steps.headline: Leave a 1.5 centimeter (0.6 in) seam.
steps.description: Stitch the strips together with the right sides facing together but leave one side open.

steps.headline: Turn the stitched piece right side facing outward.
Press.
steps.description: Place the organza under a thin towel and iron flat.

steps.headline: Use top stitch to sew all the way around the organza runner, about 1.5 centimeter (0.6 in) from the edges.
Use as required.
steps.description: The table runner will sit underneath table decorations in the centre of the table.

text: Assemble the supplies needed. These are listed below under "Things You'll Need". Cut the organza material into two strips. The strips should measure 2 meters (6.6 ft) in length and 35 centimeter (13.8 in) width. Leave a 1.5 centimeter (0.6 in) seam. Stitch the strips together with the right sides facing together but leave one side open. Clip across the corners.  Turn the stitched piece right side facing outward.  Press. Place the organza under a thin towel and iron flat. Use top stitch to sew all the way around the organza runner, about 1.5 centimeter (0.6 in) from the edges.  Use as required. The table runner will sit underneath table decorations in the centre of the table.
